content.subtitle: So yeah, be careful what you wish for in a career. Put it into the universe long enough, it will show up for you. Whether it’s what you…

7842df9fd7f5.title: Wow. I went though a similar thing.

paragraphs.text: Wow. I went though a similar thing. Ending in a “lay off” though at my last employer, a broadcast TV station. I remember being young applying for a job there as a news photog. So so very much wanted to work there. They had a swimming pool! I didn’t get it. I’d have to work in the area for over 15 years before I got in there as an engineer. I loved it…
paragraphs.name: 1d58

paragraphs.text: Best wishes for getting a job which you’ll enjoy quickly and easily. I hope that you find a much better working environment. Fingers crossed.

content.subtitle: “A journey is a person in itself; no two are alike. And all plans, safeguards, policing, and coercion are fruitless. We find that after…

313f3df76f59.title: I’ve told you this before, but I am on a similar path: I’m trying like hell to leave the TV news…

paragraphs.text: I’ve told you this before, but I am on a similar path: I’m trying like hell to leave the TV news biz and get paid to write. I have a couple of writing gigs finally, and the $$ is shit, but it’s a start. Which reminds me of this:
paragraphs.name: c3ea

paragraphs.text: By far, this… is most important. Yes!

e2ba5ada4ef9.title: Though I am sorry to hear about the constipation and sleepiness — this made me smile and then laugh…

paragraphs.text: Though I am sorry to hear about the constipation and sleepiness — this made me smile and then laugh. If quitting gives you more time to write so plainly and honestly about something that — though not writers — many of us can relate to, then I can’t be sorry for that. Lovely.
paragraphs.name: c416

paragraphs.text: Congratulations, Ezinne! You said yes to your inner self and no to the bullshit surrounding you at work. I’ve reinvented my career many times when I couldn’t keep doing what I was doing one more day and each new job was a better fit and let me to a better place of authenticity and abundance. When we’re willing to surrender for the sake of our souls…
paragraphs.name: 4fd8

9ff94b290d7f.title: Thank you for that! It means everything.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for that! It means everything.
paragraphs.name: abcc

content.subtitle: As I’ve gotten older — I realize that this isn’t necessary in order to feel successful.

paragraphs.text: Wise words! I have been conditioned by my parents to work, work, work. You have to be productive through a paycheck and if you can’t hack it — stick it through.

8a8262ca8dcf.title: As one who has had to slap the reset button a few times in my life (or had it hit for me), I can…

paragraphs.text: As one who has had to slap the reset button a few times in my life (or had it hit for me), I can offer sympathy but no brilliant advice. Well, maybe this: if you keep your eyes, ears, and mind open, sometimes amazing shit can happen to you when you aren’t expecting it. Good luck, Ezinne!

paragraphs.text: As I continue to deal with the remains of “that thing” that happened to my life last year, I have found myself without a “job” at times, even quit a few, but there is always “work.” The harvest is ripe, but the laborers are too few.
I think we need to uncondition our minds to lending our bodies to slavery. If you took the…

84ce85d1efc7.title: I found writing late, and by accident, and I absolutely agree.

paragraphs.text: I found writing late, and by accident, and I absolutely agree. The writing that sells, the voice that “resonates” (albeit mostly hollow and re-re-re-gurgitated from fifteen different sources with the same catchy picture) is simply not in me.
paragraphs.name: 4e9b

paragraphs.text: Your writing is unique and passionate. I hope you find your place. I’m glad you found your voice. ❤

virtuals.subtitle: Your writing is unique and passionate. I hope you find your place. I’m glad you found your voice. ❤

44b0a488f4c3.title: I celebrate the decision to honor your authentic self and voice!

paragraphs.text: I celebrate the decision to honor your authentic self and voice! Daily writing for a myopic, click-oriented audience must have been agonizing. Your perseverance working within that milieu is to be admired. And so is your decision to exit, stage right. Your authentic life awaits! Namasté…

paragraphs.name: a016
paragraphs.text: I am at peace. And so is she.

Clicks and stones that formed in my abdomen as I clicked with all my might through the hours of the night and recycled drippings from the machine of aggregated output — forced me to visualize how my younger self would receive this excruciating exercise.
paragraphs.name: 27af

paragraphs.text: I don’t give a damn about anything that is happening around me and I am too exhausted to pretend that I do. They are doing exactly what I wish I had been doing back in 1998 — when I was sending query letters to Honey Magazine, Jane Magazine and the rest of the brood that ruled the scene.
paragraphs.name: 923c
